comment.text: Occurs in almost all aerobically respiring organisms and serves to protect cells from the toxic effects of hydrogen peroxide. Promotes growth of cells including T-cells, B-cells, myeloid leukemia cells, melanoma cells, mastocytoma cells and normal and transformed fibroblast cells.

disease.name: Acatalasemia
disease.description: A metabolic disorder characterized by a total or near total loss of catalase activity in red cells. It is often associated with ulcerating oral lesions. Acatalasemia is inherited as an autosomal recessive trait.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: 16 N-Linked glycans (3 sites), 1 O-Linked glycan (2 sites)
FOXO-mediated transcription of oxidative stress, metabolic and neuronal genes
Expressed in bone marrow and 245 other tissues
F:oxidoreductase activity, acting on peroxide as acceptor
P:cellular response to growth factor stimulus
P:negative regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity
P:positive regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity
